result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Lawrence Handfelt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$100,000, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs shall be collected by the Department of Correction as a condition of Extended Supervision and/or Probation.
Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $472,294.63.

Defendant shall not start any business that would compete with Felderman Lawn Care.
Defendant shall not be allowed to order goods on behalf of Felderman Lawn Care.
Defendant shall not access any of the Felderman Lawn Care's financials or business transactions.
Court reserves the right to review and modify rules of supervision at any time.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall serve 12 months in the Lafayette County Jail with Huber privileges.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Lawrence Handfelt

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

2:37 PM 
Defendant Eric Lawrence Handfelt in court.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Eric Lawrence Handfelt.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Sauder Informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "NO CONTEST" .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Sauder re: her clients plea and waiver of rights.
State waives right to jury trial.
Defendant is advised of their voting rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY".

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Sauder joins in the motion.

Court Orders: Sentence Withheld Probation for a Period of 7.5 Years
-Costs
-Restitution in the amount of $472,294.63
-12 months Jail with Huber
-No complete business with Felderman Lawn Care
-No access to business financials
-Court reserves right to review rules of supervision
